Kayako - ticket id 60195349 // Andriy Rybalchenko commented publicly: Dear Tan,
Thank you for your follow-up.
The latest version of GFI MailEssentials currently available via the GFI CDN is version 22.0. You can download it directly using the following link:

	* GFI MailEssentials v22.0 Installer [https://cdndl.gfi.com/mailessentials.exe]
	* SpamTag Module (Optional) [https://cdndl.gfi.com/MailEssentialsSpamTag.exe]

Additionally, version 22.1 has been released but is not yet hosted on the official CDN. We would recommend proceeding with version 22.1, you can download it from the following temporary location:

	* GFI MailEssentials v22.1 (Google Drive) [https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/17YbBCyLbj2zW-JMu6PowUpvrQqALK5O8]

Please ensure that your license is updated and compatible with the selected version before installation. Let us know if you need assistance with the license upgrade or installation steps.

Best regards,
Andriy Rybalchenko
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

Kayako - ticket id 60195349 // Qasim Ali commented publicly: Dear Tan,

Please find the compatibility guide here https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/119127-gfi-mailessentials-system-prerequisites.

In case of issues, please share Windows Event logs [https://www.solarwinds.com/resources/it-glossary/windows-event-log], Installation logs, [https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/118699-mailessentials-common-installation-errors]and a Screenshot of the issue. Kayako - ticket id 60195349 // TAN Nguyen/TTSI - System Engineer commented publicly:  

Dear Arafat Bakhsh,

 

Thank you for your response and the articles provided.

I would like to clarify a key point regarding the "Exchange Shell connection issue" you mentioned. Before I attempted to install GFI MailEssentials, the Exchange Management Shell on our server was fully functional and accessible. The connection problem only started to occur immediately after the GFI installation failed.

This leads us to believe that the failed installation process itself may have caused the shell connectivity issue. Fortunately, we have since been able to resolve this connection problem.

Before we proceed with the installation again, could you please confirm which version of GFI MailEssentials we should use for full compatibility with our environment?

 	* Server OS: Windows Server 2019
	* Exchange Version: Microsoft Exchange 2019 CU15

We want to ensure we are using the correct version to ensure a smooth installation process.

 

 

Thanks and Best Regards, 

Tan Nguyen

System Engineer

Kayako - ticket id 60195349 // Arafat Bakhsh commented publicly: Dear Customer,

Thank you for your patience.

Based on the error in the screenshot, please apply the troubleshooting steps in the article: 'Installation Completed with Errors. Components Needed for Message Processing Could Not Be Installed' After Running Post Installation Wizard - GFI MailEssentials [https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/118691-installation-completed-with-errors-components-needed-for-message-processing-could-not-be-installed-after-running-post-installation-wizard]. You will need to address the Exchange Shell connection issue. For more information, refer to the Microsoft article: About Remote Troubleshooting [http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh847850.aspx].

Please also review the following article for the pre-requisites of installing MailEssentials on Microsoft Exchange 2019 - Microsoft Exchange Server Roles for GFI MailEssentials Installation - GFI MailEssentials [https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/119125-microsoft-exchange-server-roles-for-gfi-mailessentials-installation]

Additionally, if you are planning on upgrading to version 22, please note that you will need to make sure you have the license key for this version as it is a major version upgrade from the 21.x versions. Please reach out to the GFI Customer Care Center [https://customercare.gfi.com/hc/en-us] for assistance in upgrading the license key if you plan on using version 22.

Best regards,
Arafat Bakhsh
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

Kayako - ticket id 60195349 // Arafat Bakhsh commented privately: 	* We need to clarify that when installing version 22.0, the customer will need to have their license key upgraded as that would be a major version upgrade. 

 	* They will need to reach out to the GFI Customer Care Center [https://customercare.gfi.com/hc/en-us] 

	* I don't see any mention regarding the review of the install logs. 

	* Reviewed the logs 

	* The logs provided do not indicate a failure to install MailEssentials on Exchange 2019. They show: 

 	* A successful uninstall, followed by
 	* A successful install (status 0, “installed successfully”), with Exchange 2019 detected and the relevant components deployed

	* This KBA may or not help resolve the issue: 'Installation Completed with Errors. Components Needed for Message Processing Could Not Be Installed' After Running Post Installation Wizard - GFI MailEssentials [https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/118691-installation-completed-with-errors-components-needed-for-message-processing-could-not-be-installed-after-running-post-installation-wizard] 

 	* The article is for Exchange 2013.

 	* Cannot find any past tickets regarding the issue involving Exchange 2019.
 	* Going with Zubair's proposed solution as it addresses the core issue.

 @Zubair Farooq Note the comment on the major version upgrade - not a fail.

Kayako - ticket id 60195349 // Zubair Farooq commented privately:  Instructions [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1w6pg-Lqz1Y5n8Gah7JXTRAnNEgnLGDgQn0p4EE_DdyU/edit#bookmark=id.nmtleyh2xrkb] 

WHAT IS YOUR PROPOSED ACTION?
(REQUIRED: SELECT ONE, DELETE THE REST)

 	* Send to customer

 =============================================================== 

WHAT IS THE PR TO THE CUSTOMER?

 Dear Customer, 

 Thank you for contacting the MailEssentials Support Team. 

 The error you shared indicate a connection problem on the Microsoft or network side and solving them does fall outside of the scope of GFI's technical support. You need to address the Exchange Shell connection issue. For more information, refer to the Microsoft article: About Remote Troubleshooting [http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh847850.aspx]. 

 Once the underlying connection issue has been resolved, run the Post Installation Wizard again. 

 Best regards, 
 Zubair Farooq 
 Support Team
